data.title: Elias Doughty (1632-1690)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Elias Doughty born 1632 Oldbury, Warwickshire,  England died 1690 Flushing, Queens County, Long Island, New York including ancestors + descendants + 5 genealogist comments + questions + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors

[spouse(s) unknown]

Descendants

Profile last modified 19 Jan 2024 | Created 5 Apr 2012

This page has been accessed 3,181 times.

Contents

1 Disputed Wife

2 Biography

3 Research Notes

4 Sources

5 Acknowledgments

Disputed Wife

Elias’ wife is referred to only as Sarah in several sources or Sarah O’Neal [1] [2][3]

Biography

Elias was born in 1632. He is the son of Francis Doughty and Bridgette Stone. In 1634 he was named in the will of his grandfather Francis.[4] [5]

His family emigrated to Massachusetts in 1638. They moved several times, finally settling in Newtown, Long Island.

1658-60 Elias Doughty and Sarah (Unknown) were married in Flushing, Long Island, New Netherland (later Queens County, New York). [6][7] Sarah died in 1726.

U.S. and International Marriage Records, 1560-1900 View record Record details Name Cornet Elias Doughty Gender Male Birth Place En Birth Year 1632 Spouse Name Sarah Doughty Spouse Birth Year 1632 Marriage Year 1659 Marriage State NY Number Pages 1

Children (all born in Flushing) [8]

Mary Doughty. Born about 1658. She married at Flushing on July 6/1676-7, Thomas Hick, born at Hempstead in 1640.

Elias born 1664. Married Sarah Hinchman 1690

Jacob Doughty born 1672

Charles Doughty born 1667

William Doughty born 1676

Research Notes

Posted anonymously on Ancestry.com:

Elias Doughty was a son of Rev. Francis Doughty and a Magistrate of Flushing. Francis’ sister Mary was the wife of Adriaen van der Donck, the first historian of new Netherland, after whose death she married Hugh O'Neale of Maryland.

Sources

↑ Torrey, Clarence A. U.S., New England Marriages Prior to 1700 Page 227

↑ The New York genealogical and biographical record by Greene, Richard Henry, 1839-1926; Stiles, Henry Reed, 1832-1909; Dwight, Melatiah Everett; Morrison, George Austin, 1864-1916; Mott, Hopper Striker, 1854-1924; Totten, John Reynolds, 1856-1936; Pitman, H. Minot (Harold Minot), 1888-; Ditmas, Charles Andrew, 1887-1938; De Forest, Louis Effingham, 1891-; Mann, Conklin; Maynard, Arthur S; New York Genealogical and Biographical Society

↑ https://www-personal.umich.edu/~bobwolfe/gen/mn/m5356x5390.htm Notes for Elias and Sarah

↑ England & Wales, Prerogative Court of Canterbury Wills, 1384-1858 Ancestry Record 5111 #845187

↑ Leslie Mahler, "The English Ancestry of Richard Dole of Newbury, Massachusetts with a Note on Francis Doughty, Minister of Long Island," The American Genealogist 74 (1999), 53-57, at 57, provides a description of this record from the Rangeworth parish register, stating that "In 1632 one Fr. Doughtie was curate at Rangeworthy, and on 24 February 1632[/33], 'Eliah son of Francis Doughty' was baptized there." The article cites FHL film 417152, [AmericanAncestors].

↑ The New York genealogical and biographical record, Greene, Richard Henry, 1839-1926; Stiles, Henry Reed, 1832-1909; Dwight, Melatiah Everett; Morrison, George Austin, 1864-1916; Mott, Hopper Striker, 1854-1924; Totten, John Reynolds, 1856-1936; Pitman, H.
